reviews.title: Stunning Views, Decor, and Even Better Service!
reviews.text: This hotel is a cut above when you are staying in Sorrento. The rooms are beautiful with views that are drop dead gorgeous (My wife fell in love as soon as she opened the door!).

The staff is extremely kind and helpful. They even arranged for a special dinner at a family owned restaurant 15 minutes outside of Sorrento. The owner of the restaurant's son picked us up from the hotel and returned us later that evening at no charge!

reviews.text: This is hotel was amazing. Staff was warm and beyond helpful. The terrace for breakfast had a view of the Bay and Vesuvius. The owner lives in the hotel. The décor is stunning. Our room was too! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night in the JR suite with the balcony....what a view. The hotel is perfectly located for the view and away for the tourist crush of Sorrento (but a very easy walk). The hotel is just stunning. Although we weren't fans of Sorrento, we thought this hotel was lovely and worth a visit.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property and View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to enjoy 4 nights at this beautiful hotel, we felt like we were staying at someone's villa. Maison La Mivervetta is like no other hotel we ever stayed at.The décor is so bright and cheery. The main sitting area has very unusual decorative pieces and tons of interesting books to browse. The large terrace with deck chairs overlooking the bay and Mt. Vesuvius is breathtaking. The corner room we had was very large and spotlessly clean, with large windows on two sides and a small terrace. The staff was extremely accommodating, we had a small problem in our room and they did everything possible to remedy the situation immediately.I would suggest to anyone who wants to open a small hotel that they should come and look at this place to see how it should be done The hotel is about a 7 minute walk into town along a narrow sidewalk, but I found it nice not to be in the center of Sorrento.
reviews.title: the best hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights while on our honeymoon. The hotel itself was like nothing we had ever seen--so bright, colorful and beautifully-decorated. The views were absolutely breathtaking, especially from the room, which had floor-to-ceiling windows, and the outdoor patio on the top floor. The staff was excellent and extremely helpful and recommended a delicious pizza place downtown for lunch one day. The breakfast was unbelievable as well. We were devastated when it was time to leave and are looking forward to the time when we can return!
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.title: Come back to La Minervetta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived into Hotel Minervetta after a week long holiday, and both were looking forward to experiencing Sorrento for the first time. My initial reaction upon entering the hotel, was that this felt more like a home than a hotel. A lot of care and attention has been added throughout, with designer furniture, books, and ornaments scattered throughout. But far and away the best asset this hotel is not the assets, it's the room sea views.

reviews.title: Beautiful views, excellent service, great art

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If this isn’t the best hotel we’ve ever stayed in, I’m struggling to think of one better. Everything about it was perfect. The rooms are magnificent; all with the most spectacular views over the Bay of Naples and Vesuvius beyond. Everything you can think of (the staff, service, breakfast, cleanliness etc etc) are completely beyond reproach. We especially loved our limoncellos on the terrace before (and sometimes after) dinner – thanks Paulo. They have no restaurant as such, but have a relationship with Ristorante Bagni Delfino (separate review) in the fishing village below (three hundred steps of a private staircase – okay on the way down but a bit harder on the way up after an excellent dinner, wine and free limoncellos!). The hotel would book a table and we always got the best ones – lunch and three dinners. What more can be said that hasn’t already been said by others. My wife and I actually felt sorry for the thousands of people who didn’t stay there – but don’t tell them, let’s keep it to ourselves. If you’ve booked already and are just checking if it’s okay – it most certainly is. If you’re thinking of booking, just do it. And if you haven’t… well there’s always next year.
reviews.title: Believe the other reviews!
